column1: Barack Obama was the 44th President of the United States.
Apple Inc. is headquartered in Cupertino, California.
The Eiffel Tower is located in Paris, France.
Albert Einstein was a renowned physicist born on March 14, 1879.
The Beatles were an influential band formed in Liverpool, England.
Google was founded by Larry Page and Sergey Brin in September 1998.
The Great Wall of China stretches over 13,000 miles across China.
Nelson Mandela was a prominent anti-apartheid activist and politician.
New York City is known for its bustling streets and iconic skyline.
Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world.
Elon Musk is the CEO of SpaceX and Tesla.
The Mona Lisa is housed in the Louvre Museum in Paris, France.
Shakespeare's plays are widely regarded as literary masterpieces.
The United Nations was founded in 1945 to promote international cooperation.
Leonardo da Vinci was a polymath known for his paintings and inventions.
